messages.content: @Development need to build a strong referral program. This will get people to refer strong web3 projects in exchange for some equity if the company is selected.
Any ideas?
Have a typeform where people submit who referred them?
Brainstorm:
NFT of a referal

or how it deals with multiple people doing a referral
Gitcoin grants is always a good place to start

or something like it -:)
Faster turnaround time if you get a referral?
1 week -> 24 hours

I was thinking of having an application token. When you apply you spend the token. You could sell the token. You could also send it to someone so they apply in exchange for carry. Easy to track who gave a token to who.
What would sell of an application token mean?
Who’s minting them?
It seems slightly overcomplicated for a generally simple thing?
that is certainly a better design except: good founders know other good founders. It seems bad to restrict to one application
Yeah def don't do that now

You can have the smart contract have a built in “carry” assigned to the lead/sponsor where on liquidity event you get a percent of carry. The way carry is assigned is there a step in the voting process called sponsoring, so even if someone else applies, only a member can sponsor, and basically put their “stake” on an investment that they think it should go through a vote
Like you'd give a good founder 3 tokens
Oh, what if you get limited number of referal tokens. You should choose who to refer and you spend you tokens on referring

Make a referral systems gamified on a leaderboard with the ultimatum of part ownership in Hyperscale to the DAO or something like that

Check royal's referral system as an example, they did it extremely well

https://royal.io/

Exactly. Which is carry
We need to attach carry as a sliding scale to liquidity event - how “good” of an investment (return) is it. So if it’s 1x investment, you get 1% carry, 5x 3%, etc
It’s not enough that you’re referring and they’re going through
Like a finder's fee
Yeah, it's what https://www.seedscout.com/ is doing

Each founders get's 5-10 tokens. 
They can either sell it, or they could refer another founder using that token. Referral token transfer to a company that gets funded also gets a carry of the deal.
I don’t think funding is a criterion of success. You need to put a higher bar
why don't we incentivize research instead of referrals... then use a combination of AI / crowd intelligence / expert panel (whatever is ultimately decided) to filter the wheat from the chaff

if we incentivize direct referrals we're relying on existing social connections. whereas with research you gain breadth. and hopefully projects that otherwise would never see the light of day / get this opportunity.
Why this over a fixed percentage. If the company does well the fixed percentage is worth more?
It’s what traditional VCs already do, higher carry for better performance
Better alignment for finding “good” investments

for referral, perhaps we can do something with co-investing-- e.g. if someone refers a great project and it gets selected, we can either reward them with some percentage of the tokenshare that hyperscale takes (as a bounty) or create some predetermined mechanism for allocating tokenshare to them outside of it

Can be kinda centralised at the moment, until we hash out contracts for hyperscale

I like the idea of using a % of tokenshare as a bounty, if somebody refers "low quality" project, the referee gets a "low quality" token, and same for "high quality" projects, ideally it should be always high quality but this is not reality, basically the value of what you get depends on the quality of what you refer.

I wonder if there’s a way to also seed some participation across the ecosystem so that all funded projects own a little slice of the success of all of the other hyperscale funded projects? Would encourage interoperability and collaboration across teams as well as cross-promo for a whole group of port co’s (and seems to follow a model happening across many token or coin specific funding mechanisms for their portfolio co’s)
i agree. community is crucial in #web3 and will be a big value add
Love this idea! It gives founders an incentive to work with us vs. other DAOs and give back to the DAO

We could set up a treasury with our own token (HYPE) using something like https://juicebox.money/#/ Anytime someone refers a project that gets funding, they get HYPE. HYPE can be redeemed at anytime (for USDC or some stable coin) but the longer they hold, the more likely they will be able to redeem HYPE for more USDC (assuming we do well). 

The treasury would be a representation of all our investments so the referrer would own a little slice of all funded hyperscale projects.

**More details**: Our treasury would mint HYPE when we make an investment or realize returns from an investment. When we make an investment, we put 200,000 USDC (for instance) into the treasury and mint some amount of HYPE, lets say 2 mil HYPE. The DAO that we are investing in receives that 2 mil HYPE. At any point in time they can "burn" their HYPE in order to receive USDC from the treasury.  

Anytime we realize returns from our investments. The DAO pays us back in USDC which we put into the treasury, thus minting more HYPE. There are many ways we can distribute the newly minted HYPE to hyperscale community members. HYPE holders can then burn HYPE to redeem USDC from the treasury at any given time.  

So for the referral program, we can give a referrer HYPE each time they refer a deal that we decide to invest in. The referrer can hold onto this token (which would likely rise in value) and cash out at anytime by burning their HYPE for USDC.  

**To Be Honest**: I don't fully understand why tokens like this (HYPE) rise in value as much as they do. Seems largely due to speculation? Some tokens have a bonding curve and a discount rate which effect the USDC per HYPE ratio over time. I mention this so that if anyone understands why why the price of HYPE would rise in this scenario, I'd love a clear explanation. Look at JBX and PEOPLE, they use this same model for a different use case and their coins have become more valuable over time compared to the initial investment.

Vesting periods could be interesting as well to promote long term success bias when vetting projects.

Pulling in a few of the above - a co-investment award of HYPE, especially if the Hyperscale treasury owns the liquidity (USDC, the project token, etc) seems correct (h/t @shira and @nicklinck). Linking in cross participation for funded companies via HYPE should be pretty straightforward then (h/t @jennifer hinkel).

Given all of that, I think we shouldn't be rewarding simple referrals - we should be rewarding research/analysis. Not only does that remove low quality entries (some proof of work) and creates some skin in the game, it also allows us to continue to train AI systems on the analyst/provided analysis/project outcomes.
We can also allow multiple analyses of the same company under this system.
Interesting! I like that they should be rewarded for some kind of report that they give us
I think both could work.  Referral incentives exist for both leads and closed deals (the latter being more material obviously) but I do like rewarding research and analysis work as well.
We could value the contributions differently - so regular referrals are worth X, analysis reports worth Y.
